name: Crystal Cove Beach Resort on Sapphire Bay

reviews.title: "Why Go Anywhere Else?
reviews.text: I have been going to Crystal Cove 2 to 3 times each winter since the mid 80's. I deal with Alice and Bernie at Paradise Properties.They rent out privetely owned condos. I have been to many other beach vacation spots including all the popular ones in Mexaco and ,of course Aruba and the different Bahama Islands . I love the fact that this is US,reasonably close to the East Coast and for an island,not that expensive You can "chill" or have as much activity as you need . There are some great bars---Latitude 18, Duffy's Love Shack,Molly Malone,etc If you need "high end",that is also available. In short,I can't wait till the end of Nov. when I can return " Try it, you will like it"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon at the Crystal Cove Beach Resort. We stayed in a condo in the B building. It was absolutely beautiful!! We had some trouble finding the check in area but someone from the lobby was kind enough to drive to where we were and show us the way. When we arrived, we were told that the cleaning service would come every other day. They came and did an excellent job every time!! The concierge service was excellent, they made all of our reservations and also recommended an excellent sailboat trip to St. John and Greater St. James. We were able to enjoy some of the best snorkeling during that day. From the first day that we arrived, the front desk gave us complimentary snorkeling gear which was very useful during our stay. My husband and I also enjoyed sitting out on the beach chairs at night and listening to the ocean. St. Thomas was the perfect choice for our honeymoon! It was very romantic with a lot of secret areas. We spent a tremendous amount of time exploring the island. Every day was perfect!!
reviews.title: What a Beautiful Place!!

reviews.text: Our family traveled back to Crystal Cove again this year after staying there about 4 years ago. As many of the other reviews indicated, Crystal Cove and Sapphire Beach can't be beat. We stayed in one of the A buildings during July 09, again rented thru Dave at bestbeach.com, with Norma (housekeeper) taking good care of us. Crystal Cove is not an "all one price" resort. So if you want that look elsewhere. But it does offer excellent condos, a beautiful beach and excellent snorkeling right out your front door with beautifully kept grounds. As others have noted, the adjacent resort has gone downhill, but that didn't bother us much.
reviews.title: Crystal Cove A Building Cannot be Beat

reviews.text: Other observations/tips: –
reviews.title: Best vacation we've ever had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night we stayed at the Best Western Emerald Beach by the airport, nice hotel, nice beach.
reviews.title: Crystal Cove B-11
Be careful, not all condos are equal !
reviews.text: Yes, I think there are two different Crystal Coves. We booked our vac. through Travelocity. Travelocity advertised Crystal Cove Condos ( they did not mention Sapphire Resort or Antilles Resort ). I had high expectations after reading all the good reviews. When we arrived @ CC, we were sent to the Sapphire hotel to check-in. We were assigned condo unit B-3, when we walked in our hearts simmediately SUNK. It was HORRIBLE !!-- reminded me of a roadside $ 39.99 special. We were tired from travel all day. We tried to sleep on the bed -- lumpy, thin mattress-- very, very uncomfortable !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got up the next morning, needed coffee and shower. The coffee pot broke after just a half-a-pot. Okay, lets shower ( we really needed a shower.) & go eat breakfast in Red Hook. Guess what-- no water. A water main had broken. I was terribly disappointed and upset. I marched over to the Sapphire desk, and demanded a different room. There was only one there unit available, sometime around noon.
reviews.title: Unit A-7 at Crystal Cove Condos Sapphire Beach was Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started talking to some of the other people staying there, it seems their condo units were very nice. People started showing us some of the units they were staying in. The units other people were staying in were very, very nice.--- I definitely felt screwed by Travelocity. I called Travelocity and told them we were checking out, & I wanted a refund for the remaing nights. After 3 or 4 phone calls, Travelocity agreed to reimburse me for the remaing nights, if I choose to check-out. I checked out !!-- but stayed (a little confusing)
reviews.title: Could there be more than one Crystal Cove at Sapphire Bay???

reviews.text: I've stayed at Secret Harbour the previous 2 years, & immediately wanted to go back tto Secret Harbour. People at CC are very friendly & nice. Norma, manages some the condos @ CC, she heard about our delinma. She managed to find us a very nice condo for the remaining stay, so we wouldn't have to leave CC. All the condos seem to be privatedly owned, but are managed by different management.
reviews.title: Nothing like the pictures...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After moving to a different condo, we were extremely pleased. We finally got a SHOWER !! THANK YOU NORMA !!!
reviews.title: Simply Wonderfull
Great place to stay in St. Thomas
reviews.text: We rented unit D2 from Julie Bargeski for a week at the beginning of June. It was our first visit to St. Thomas, and we had a great time. The unit itself is very bright and clean, and we really came to appreciate the convenience of being able to prepare some of our own meals. I also liked having the murphy beds for the kids which I think are more comfortable than a sofa bed. Having two full baths is also a plus. The condo complex itself is very well maintained, the grounds are beautifully maintained, and sapphire beach, which is literally steps away, is beautiful and lives up to its name. Using the 1$ safari bus's we could get around to do grocery shopping and into town (although it is strange why they only go in one direction). The next week we went to the Marriott, but in terms of the beach and convenience, Crystal Cove was probably better. I highly recommend Coki beach where we were surrounded by large tropical fish just standing waist deep in the crystal clear waters.

Booked through VRBO as we have done over the past few years. Steve and Honey were great to work with and left us with no questions. We have stayed in Sapphire before and knew what to expect. Steve and Honey delivered.
reviews.title: Relaxation starts Now

reviews.text: Picked up the keys mid-afternoon and brought our groceries into a beautiful, air conditioned, bug free, well kept and clean unit B-11. A bag of ice was in the freezer ready to mix up some cocktails from the liquors left in the bar area. Upon arrival, all you have to do is put away the groceries and unpack then walk 100 footsteps to the beach. As you walk by the lagoon look for the iguanas basking on the island or on the walkway or on the manicured lawn.
reviews.title: Great place to stay on first visit to St. Thomas

reviews.text: Beach time is the best here on Sapphire beach. Plenty of breeze to keep you cool. Sea Grape trees provide plenty of shade in the afternoon. If you don't feel like walking the 100 steps back for refreshments, there is always someone walking by with a menu offering food and drinks! Being an avid diver I enjoyed snorkeling around the reefs 100 yds off the beach. Still only 20ft deep but plenty of sealife to find just go slow and dive to the bottom, to look not touch, and peak under some of the ledges. Spiny lobster, puffer, reef squid, rays, trunk fish, parrot fish, trumpet fish and turtles to name a few of the more interesting finds in shallow water. Snorkel equipment is available through unit B-11. Steve has a great selection of fins, masks and snorkels stored under the large bench seat. For those that prefer to just relax, there are also floats and noodles that are in the unit to add to your fun.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!
Location, Location!..... The "A" Building is awesome!
reviews.text: The well stocked kitchen allowed us to fix our meals quite easily. Driving the 5 minutes (literally parking space to parking space) to Red Hook gives you the chance to eat continental, Italian, Irish and sushi. Plus you have Duffy's, Island Time and a few other bars in the area.

Upon booking the property thru the bestbeach.com site, We were so excited for this trip. We had been to St. Thomas before, staying at the Marriott, so we kinda knew the island and our way around. This location is right near the ferry to St. John and away from the touristy shopping of Charlotte Amiele so we figured it would be great.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for - Go to the Ritz a few miles away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything did not go smoothly or as I expected. At the top of the list was the fact that there was no crib ready when we arrived. Still I can understand a small oversight, but the response to the problem really set the tone. Saturday when we arrived we spoke to Norma, who said she would bring one over. We never heard or saw her the rest of the day. Sunday morning I called her and she said had some family emergency and it would get done. Still nothing. Monday afternoon finally she arrives for housekeeping and brings one. I wasn't expecting top notch service, but I'd say her housekeeping was less than adequate. Towels were left lying around. Bathrooms were not cleaned. She then decided to skip Tuesday and Thursday housekeeping. She also ran the dishwasher on Wed, which leaked and left a pool of water in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Crystal Cove Beach Resort was fabulous and we met the nicest people there who will be our friends forever now.

reviews.text: Other miscellaneous problems included a light falling out of its socket in the kitchen, 3/4 of the channels on the cable tv in the bedroom not working, and a couple of bugs in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Good value but know what to expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was just not what I had expected or imagined. We asked Dave the property owner for a 50% refund and he generously agreed, so I'd say kudos to him. We paid $1650 for 6 nights.
reviews.title: We will return to Crystal next year - - avoid Sapphire Bay Condos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beyond that there's a market in the town across from the ferry, avoid all bread products there. Humidity and heat are friends of mold. Duffy's in the parking lot is a must, we did once or twice a day. The beach isn't even that nice, cats and iguanas everywhere = poop. Bring Off if you don't like mosquitos. Resort next door to Crystal cove, is run-down and deserted, restaurant was closed. Snorkeling out front is ok, bit murky, did see a turtle. Pool is stagnant water, wouldn't let my kid touch it.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Vacation

aka: Crystal Cove Beach Resort On Sapphire Bay Hotel
